title.narrative: Humanitarian Assistance to Displaced Population in Lac Province, Chad

description.narrative: Since 2014, the crisis unfolding in the Lac province in Chad has been characterized by numerous challenging factors, such as insecurity, flooding, important and continuous movements of population (Internally Displaced Persons (IDPs), returnees) as well as community-clashes and socioeconomic-related tensions. Currently more than 400,000 Persons are internally displaced within the Lac Province, mainly due to the deterioration of security conditions. These persons were forced to flee their homes suddenly, leaving behind assets, food and other belongings. Over the years, IOM has supported the Government of Chad in the provision of assistance to displaced population but the worsening of the displacement situation in the country calls for renewed efforts to strengthen humanitarian efforts in the country, especially in the context of the COVID-19 pandemic which has affected movement of goods and personnel – in addition to creating a public health emergency. To provide lifesaving assistance in the Lac province IOM’s planned response focuses on enhancement of displacement data management to support decision-making, planification and direct assistance, through the Displacement Tracking Matrix (DTM)’s Mobility tracking and continuation of the implementation of rapid biometric registration; and shelters and non-food items procurement and distribution for most vulnerable displaced people.
